articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned on Thursday that the U.N. Charter was under assault like never before as the 193-member world body marked the 80th anniversary of the signing of its founding document.
articles.title: UN chief warns 80-year-old founding charter 'not an a la carte menu'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli gunfire and airstrikes killed at least 21 Palestinians in the Gaza Strip on Thursday, local health authorities said, as mediators reached out to Israel and Hamas to seek a resumption of ceasefire talks to end the war.
articles.title: Israeli attacks kill at least 21 people in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran would respond to any future U.S. attack by striking American military bases in the Middle East, Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Thursday, in his first televised remarks since a ceasefire was reached between Iran and Israel.
articles.title: Supreme leader, in first appearance since ceasefire, says Iran would strike back if attacked

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: The White House on Wednesday recommended terminating U.S. funding for nearly two dozen programs that conduct war crimes and accountability work globally, including in Myanmar, Syria and on alleged Russian atrocities in Ukraine, according to two U.S. sources familiar with the matter and internal government documents reviewed by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: White House wants deep cut in US funding for war crimes investigations, sources say

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart, Susan Heavey
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth on Thursday said he was unaware of any intelligence suggesting Iran had moved any of its highly enriched uranium to shield it from U.S. strikes on Iran's nuclear program over the weekend.
articles.title: No known intelligence that Iran moved uranium, US defense chief says

articles.author: Sakshi Dayal, Allison Lampert
articles.description: Investigators have downloaded flight recorder data from an Air India crash this month that killed 260 people, India's civil aviation ministry said on Thursday, a long-awaited step towards understanding the world's worst aviation disaster in a decade.
articles.title: Indian investigators download black box data from fatal Air India crash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian troops have taken control of a village in eastern Ukraine which is close to a lithium deposit after fierce resistance from Ukrainian forces, a Russian-backed official said on Thursday.
articles.title: Russia captures village in eastern Ukraine near lithium deposit, Russian-backed official says

articles.author: Georgina Mccartney, Arathy Somasekhar
articles.description: Vessels near the Strait of Hormuz have been broadcasting unusual messages concerning nationality in a bid to avoid being attacked as doubts linger over the ceasefire between Israel and Iran, according to maritime risk analytics firm Windward and ship tracking data on Thursday.
articles.title: Vessels near Strait of Hormuz transmit unusual messages to prevent attacks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Defence ministers of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) meeting in China were unable to adopt a joint statement at the end of their talks due to a lack of consensus on referring to "terrorism", the Indian foreign ministry said on Thursday.
articles.title: India says defence gathering in China unable to adopt joint statement

articles.author: Monicah Mwangi, Christophe Perre, Edwin Okoth
articles.description: Kenya's Interior Minister Kipchumba Murkomen accused protesters on Thursday of attempting to overthrow the government during a day of deadly demonstrations, remarks that protest leaders said were an attempt to deflect attention from their demands.
articles.title: Kenya interior minister accuses protesters of coup attempt after deadly demonstrations
